Package me.mayhem.util.screen

Class UtilScreen

java.lang.Object
me.mayhem.util.screen.UtilScreen
public class UtilScreen
extends java.lang.Object
Static utility class for determining if an Entity or Vector are off the screen, and which side of the screen they have run off (or are getting close to)

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int SCREEN_RADIUS
    The radius around the edge of the screen to prevent the player getting too close before moving the screen

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    UtilScreen()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static boolean isOffScreen​(Entity entity)
    Main method for checking if the entity is off/close to any edge of the screen (left, right, up, or down)
    static boolean isOffScreenBottomY​(Vector position, Vector motion, int height)
    Checks if the position, with given motion and height applied, is off the bottom of the screen (or within the radius)
    static boolean isOffScreenLeftX​(Vector position, Vector motion)
    Checks if the position, with the given motion, is off the screen on the left (or within the radius) Width check is not required here as the entity's is always at the top left (JSFML)
    static boolean isOffScreenRightX​(Vector position, Vector motion, int width)
    Checks if the position, with the given motion and width, is off the screen on the right (or within the radius)
    static boolean isOffScreenTopY​(Vector position, Vector motion)
    Checks if the position, with given motion, is off the top of the screen (or within the radius) Height is not required here as the entity's position always starts from the top left (JSFML)
    static boolean isOffScreenX​(Entity entity)
    Checks if the given entity is off the left or right hand side of the screen using their positon, and motion to pre-determine if they will be going off the screen
    static boolean isOffScreenY​(Entity entity)
    Checks if the given entity is off the top or bottom of the screen using their position, and motion to pre-determine if they will be going off the screen

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • SCREEN_RADIUS

      public static final int SCREEN_RADIUS
      The radius around the edge of the screen to prevent the player getting too close before moving the screen
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • UtilScreen

      public UtilScreen()

  • Method Details

    • isOffScreen

      public static boolean isOffScreen​(Entity entity)
      Main method for checking if the entity is off/close to any edge of the screen (left, right, up, or down)
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to check
      Returns:
      If they're too close to the edge (or off it completely)

    • isOffScreenX

      public static boolean isOffScreenX​(Entity entity)
      Checks if the given entity is off the left or right hand side of the screen using their positon, and motion to pre-determine if they will be going off the screen
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to check
      Returns:
      True if off the screen - false if not

    • isOffScreenRightX

      public static boolean isOffScreenRightX​(Vector position, Vector motion, int width)
      Checks if the position, with the given motion and width, is off the screen on the right (or within the radius)
      Parameters:
      position - The position to check
      motion - the motion to apply
      width - The width to apply
      Returns:
      True if off the screen - false if not

    • isOffScreenLeftX

      public static boolean isOffScreenLeftX​(Vector position, Vector motion)
      Checks if the position, with the given motion, is off the screen on the left (or within the radius) Width check is not required here as the entity's is always at the top left (JSFML)
      Parameters:
      position - The position to check
      motion - the motion to apply
      Returns:
      True if off the screen - false if not

    • isOffScreenY

      public static boolean isOffScreenY​(Entity entity)
      Checks if the given entity is off the top or bottom of the screen using their position, and motion to pre-determine if they will be going off the screen
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to check
      Returns:
      True if off the screen - false if not

    • isOffScreenBottomY

      public static boolean isOffScreenBottomY​(Vector position, Vector motion, int height)
      Checks if the position, with given motion and height applied, is off the bottom of the screen (or within the radius)
      Parameters:
      position - The position to check
      motion - The motion to apply
      height - The height to apply
      Returns:
      True if off the screen - false if not

    • isOffScreenTopY

      public static boolean isOffScreenTopY​(Vector position, Vector motion)
      Checks if the position, with given motion, is off the top of the screen (or within the radius) Height is not required here as the entity's position always starts from the top left (JSFML)
      Parameters:
      position - The position to check
      motion - The motion to apply
      Returns:
      True if off the screen - false if not
